str2: And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
Of Latin origin but uncertain significance; Titus, a Christian.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 1st Person Singular
str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
A sharer, partner, companion. From koinos; a sharer, i.e. Associate.
A fellow worker, associate, helper. From a presumed compound of sun and the base of ergon; a co-laborer, i.e. Coadjutor.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
